meanings.definition: A person who edits or revises written material.
meanings.sent1: The redactor carefully reviewed the article for any mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The redactor made sure the book was error-free before it went to print.
meanings.sent3: The redactor found a funny typo in the document and fixed it quickly.
meanings.sent4: She was a redactor, polishing the text until it shone like a diamond.
meanings.sent5: The redactor's keen eye caught every small error in the manuscript.

meanings.definition: An editor or reviser of a text.
meanings.sent1: As a redactor, he improved the clarity of the article.
meanings.sent2: The redactor suggested changes to enhance the flow of the story.
meanings.sent3: The redactor playfully added a joke to the text for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her role as a redactor transformed the text into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The redactor's revisions breathed new life into the old manuscript.

meanings.definition: One who prepares a document for publication.
meanings.sent1: The redactor ensured the document was ready for printing.
meanings.sent2: As a redactor, she finalized the layout of the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The redactor playfully added a surprise ending to the story.
meanings.sent4: The redactor's touch turned the document into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The redactor's attention to detail made the publication flawless.
